channel.title: Declaring multi-dem array in a for loop
channel.description:
how would I go about declaring [code]distances[i][0]=mondis,monid[/code]
i've tried stuff from the internets like [Code] distances[i][0]={mondis,monid};[/code]
i'm using a for loop to assign calculated data to the array, mondis in the first and monid as the secondary: [code]distances[i][0][/code]. I might have the whole picture on multi-dem arrays off :/ . My main objective is to sort the distances, then search through the double to find the shortest distances's linked id.
** Should I just go about making two arrays in sync? Then just create the multi after?

item.title: Declaring multi-dem array in a for loop
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

indeed, thank you very much the syntax makes sense

Read full topic
item.source: Declaring multi-dem array in a for loop

item.title: Declaring multi-dem array in a for loop
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

By “multi-dem” I suppose you mean multidimensional.

distances[i][0]={mondis,monid};
->
distances[i] = new double[] {mondis, monid};

This is the correct syntax for that operation.

Read full topic
item.source: Declaring multi-dem array in a for loop
